ingredients: 500g chicken (bone-in), 2 cups basmati rice (soaked for 30 minutes), 2 onions (sliced), 2 tomatoes (chopped), 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, Â½ cup yogurt, 2 green chilies (slit), 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tbsp biryani masala, 4 tbsp oil or ghee, Salt to taste, Fresh mint and cilantro for garnish, Saffron strands soaked in warm milk.
instructions: Heat oil or ghee in a pan, fry sliced onions until golden brown, and set aside.
In the same pan, add ginger-garlic paste, green chilies, and chicken pieces. Cook until browned. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, biryani masala, and salt. Stir well.
Add tomatoes and yogurt, and cook until the oil separates and the chicken is cooked through.  Meanwhile, cook the rice in boiling water until 70% done. Drain and set aside.
In a large pot, layer half the rice, then the chicken mixture, and top with the remaining rice.
Drizzle saffron milk, fried onions, and garnish with mint and cilantro. Cover with a tight-fitting lid and cook on low heat (Dum) for 20 minutes.
